pageProps.contentHtml:
Lp spaces

Show that

A={f∈L3(R) | ∫R∣f(x)∣2 dx<∞}A = \set{f \in L^3\p{\R} \st \int_\R \abs{f\p{x}}^2 \,\diff{x} < \infty}A={f∈L3(R)∣∣​∫R​∣f(x)∣2dx<∞}

is a Borel subset of L3(R3)L^3\p{\R^3}L3(R3).
Solution.

Consider φN ⁣:L3(R)→R\func{\phi_N}{L^3\p{\R}}{\R}φN​:L3(R)→R given by

φN(f)=∫−NN∣f(x)∣2 dx.\phi_N\p{f} = \int_{-N}^N \abs{f\p{x}}^2 \,\diff{x}.φN​(f)=∫−NN​∣f(x)∣2dx.

Observe that

∣φN(f)−φN(g)∣≤∫−NN∣f(x)∣2−∣g(x)∣2 dx≤∫−NN∣f(x)−g(x)∣(∣f(x)∣+∣g(x)∣) dx≤∥f−g∥L3∥∣f∣+∣g∣∥L3/2([−N,N]).\begin{aligned} \abs{\phi_N\p{f} - \phi_N\p{g}} &\leq \int_{-N}^N \abs{f\p{x}}^2 - \abs{g\p{x}}^2 \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq \int_{-N}^N \abs{f\p{x} - g\p{x}}\p{\abs{f\p{x}} + \abs{g\p{x}}} \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq \norm{f - g}_{L^3}\norm{\abs{f} + \abs{g}}_{L^{3/2}\p{\br{-N,N}}}. \end{aligned}∣φN​(f)−φN​(g)∣​≤∫−NN​∣f(x)∣2−∣g(x)∣2dx≤∫−NN​∣f(x)−g(x)∣(∣f(x)∣+∣g(x)∣)dx≤∥f−g∥L3​∥∣f∣+∣g∣∥L3/2([−N,N])​.​

Notice further that

∥∣f∣+∣g∣∥L3/2([−N,N])2/3=∫(∣f(x)∣+∣g(x)∣)3/2χ[−N,N](x) dx≤∥∣f∣+∣g∣∥L33/4∥χ[−N,N]∥L4/3,\begin{aligned} \norm{\abs{f} + \abs{g}}_{L^{3/2}\p{\br{-N,N}}}^{2/3} &= \int \p{\abs{f\p{x}} + \abs{g\p{x}}}^{3/2} \chi_{\br{-N,N}}\p{x} \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq \norm{\abs{f} + \abs{g}}_{L^3}^{3/4} \norm{\chi_{\br{-N,N}}}_{L^{4/3}}, \end{aligned}∥∣f∣+∣g∣∥L3/2([−N,N])2/3​​=∫(∣f(x)∣+∣g(x)∣)3/2χ[−N,N]​(x)dx≤∥∣f∣+∣g∣∥L33/4​∥∥​χ[−N,N]​∥∥​L4/3​,​

so φN\phi_NφN​ is continuous. Hence,

A=⋃k=1∞⋂N=1∞φN−1([0,k]),A = \bigcup_{k=1}^\infty \bigcap_{N=1}^\infty \phi_N^{-1}\p{\br{0, k}},A=k=1⋃∞​N=1⋂∞​φN−1​([0,k]),

so AAA is Borel.
